articles.content:
Aerial attack exercise to be held in S. Korea
   Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- The South Korean "army metropolitan defense command" announced that it would stage an aerial attack exercise in Seoul on March 23 and 26, according to a radio report from Seoul.   The warmongers also made public a plan to hold a tank control drill on March 23 and 24.   Nowadays, the South Korean rulers have frequently conducted military training even in downtown Seoul, motivated by an ulterior intention to worsen inter-Korean relations, dampen ever-mounting anti-"government" feelings of South Korean people and divert elsewhere their attention.

articles.title: Expression of deep respect for Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
President Kim Il Sung praised by Austrian
    Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- Max Verworner, chairman of the Society for the Promotion of Relations between Austria and the DPRK who is also chairman of the Austrian Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification issued a statement on March 16 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of the President Kim Il Sung.   He noted:     It was very right that the President's birthday was set as Sun's Day and that the Juche era with 1912 when he was born as the first year was instituted.   History does not know such a statesman as Kim Il Sung, who devoted his all to people, finding himself among them even on his birthdays.   The great exploits performed by the President for Korea and humankind will be immortal.   Our society is proud that it has commemorated the President's birthday as an international holiday.  We will invariably make it a tradition to commemorate the day in the future, too.

articles.title: Military attaches corps visits  Korean Revolution Museum
War hysterics carried to extremes
articles.content:
Military attaches corps visits  Korean Revolution Museum 
    Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- The military attaches corps in Korea visited the Korean Revolution Museum on Monday on the occasion of the 82nd anniversary of the formation of the Korean National Association (KNA) by Kim Hyong Jik, an outstanding leader of the anti-Japanese national liberation movement.    The KNA was an anti-Japanese underground revolutionary organization whose purpose was to achieve the independence of the country by the efforts of the Korean people.    Visitors looked round relics and materials, hearing an explanation about the revolutionary struggle of Kim Hyong Jik.

DPRK's proposal supported in Russia
    Pyongyang, March 23 (KCNA) -- The presidium of the c.c., the Communist Party of the Russian Federation released a statement on March 15 supporting the proposal made by a joint meeting of the government, political parties and organizations in the DPRK.   The statement said that the proposal is a constructive proposal which opens the road for removing military confrontation and realizing wide-ranging dialogues between the north and the south.   It urged the South Korean authorities to positively respond to initiatives and appeals made by the DPRK again  and expressed support for the new peace initiatives of the Korean people.
